title: Postgres Database Expert - Upwork
description: We are looking for a highly skilled Postgres database expert to join our team on a part-time/on demand basis. You will help (consult, implement, educate) implement a reliable and high performant database backend. Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with query tuning are also required. The ability to work independently and troubleshoot complex database issues is essential. Relevant skills: - Postgres database design and implementation - High availability setup, monitoring and troubleshooting - Partitioning, replication, and performance optimization - SQL query tuning More specifically, the first deliverable has to do with implementation of a robust High Available architecture, delivered as an automated solution (e.g. Ansible, Bash scripts etc). In addition we would want the consultant to provide documentation on the architecture they will deliver as long as help the internal DevOps team (2 people), get up to speed with the delivered solution. - Implement a robust high availability (HA) solution for PostgreSQL, preferably utilizing Patroni, HAProxy, PgBouncer, and repmgr. title: Unity Editor upgrade causing console errors in webGL builds - Upwork
description: Unity 2021.3.11f1  upgrade to Unity 2022.3.21f1 After the upgrade to 2022 we started to get a lot of similar errors/warnings (more than 100 of them) appearing in the console at the start of the project. Those errors/warnings were never before. We need to find out why these errors started to appear. There are two important moments to this issue: - these errors/warnings appear ONLY AT RUNTIME (in actual WebGL builds), and don't appear in Editor at all - these errors/warnings appear only when our project loads content scenes from asset bundles (this is our main way of working with content scenes since they all are quite heavy and we have almost a hundred of them). If, just for the purposes of testing, a WebGL build is created with content scenes included directly into the build (no scene bundles used), then no errors/warnings appear - At the same time, the issue is not related to the data in scene bundles. We can load any scene bundle and errors/warnings will be the same. Even if we leave just a single scene bundle with a basically empty scene (only camera and simple cube), the errors/warnings will still appear The example of the build can be taken here: https://s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/ivala.3dtesting/develop/upgrade-to-2022/issues/a0/index.html Attached is the example of errors/warnings. If you think you can resolve these, please get in touch with  an estimate of how long it would take. We will then be able to provide a slice of our project for you to work with, and demonstrate a fix.Skills: Unity, Git

title: Create a Jupyter Notebook that creates a repo with PyGithub - Upwork
description: ## Problem Overview I am encountering a frustrating challenge while working on integrating a GitHub application with my personal account. My goal is to develop a script that uses PyGithub, that enables the creation of a repository under my account. I'm currently trying to do so through a Jupyter notebook. I've granted pretty much every permission under the sun to the GitHub app for this to work (as far as I know). Heres some stackoverflow pages that have gotten me close, but still with no success (see these for reference): https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46524697/login-problems-using-pygithub https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28675121/how-to-create-a-new-repository-with-pygithub **How to do it?** To do this, you'll need to create a .ipynb file that does the job. This will involve creating a GitHub app (not an OAuth app, specifically a GitHub App) or use mine, save its details in an .env, download its private key file, (develop a Jupyter notebook that uses PyGithub (worst case, some other fix) and figure out the right code to make it work. Literally at my wits end with this. ### Authentication Issue Although the GitHub integration appears to authenticate without any apparent errors, I am confronted with the following issues: - The method `get_user().create_repo()` within the PyGithub library triggers an error. - An attempt to use `get_user("UserName")` results in incomplete information provided here. ### Errors Encountered The most frequent errors include: - `GithubException: 403 "message": "Resource not accessible by integration", "documentation_url": ...` - An error indicating that there is no authenticated user associated with the GitHub object. - "The integration does not have access to this resource" ### Code Snippets Below is one snippet from the Jupyter notebook I'm currently: ```python from git import Repo, GitCommandError  # Incorrect import for PyGithub; seems to be for GitPython from github import Github, Auth, GithubIntegration, GithubException def load_private_key_from_file(file_path):     with open(file_path, "r") as key_file:         private_key = key_file.read()     return private_key INSTALLATION_ID = 'XXXXXXXX' GITHUB_APP_ID = os.environ.get("GITHUB_APP_ID") PRIVATE_KEY = load_private_key_from_file("../../app.private-key.pem") CLIENT_ID = os.environ.get("GITHUB_APP_CLIENT_ID") SECRET_KEY = os.environ.get("GITHUB_APP_SECRET") auth = Auth.AppAuth(GITHUB_APP_ID, PRIVATE_KEY) integration = GithubIntegration(     GITHUB_APP_ID, PRIVATE_KEY, base_url="https://github.com/api/v3") # gi = GithubIntegration(auth=auth) for installation in gi.get_installations():     print(installation.id) print(gi.get_user_installation("YourGithubUserName").get_repos().totalCount) g = gi.get_github_for_installation(INSTALLATION_ID) g.get_user() ``` ### Configuration Details and Resources For the GitHub App, I have the following configuration details and resources available: - `GITHUB_APP_ID` - `GITHUB_APP_CLIENT_ID` - `GITHUB_APP_SECRET` - `GITHUB_APP_NAME` - A `private_key.pem` file for authentication. Although I have attempted to utilize the `GithubIntegration` class to generate an access token, challenges persist. ### Core Issue Despite all the experimenting, doc reading, and Stack Overflow, I am struggling to authenticate successfully and execute actions through the GitHub API through PyGithub, specifically to create repositories under my account. ### What I Need You to Do The goal is simple - make an .ipynb script that creates a repo on a users account for them using a Github App.Skills: GitHub

The candidate must have a mature understanding of Wi-Fi concepts. • Project management o Take command of a project to ensure all engineering implementation tasks are progressing toward launch of projects. o Ensure field personnel and contractors adhere to prep and build procedures so problems can be identified early, tasks can be completed in parallel, and launch delay/contractor idleness are avoided. o Ensure field personnel and contractors adhere to designs by being hyper-aware of build progress.   Identify divergences before causing redesign/launch delays. o When minor adjustments to design are necessary, ensure documentation is updated in real time. o Hand off and ensure parallel tasks are being completed by additional engineering team members. • Equipment Configuration o Follow configuration procedures for configuring: Routers, Switches, Microwave PTPs, G.hn hubs, Fiber hubs, Wi-Fi access points, and monitoring devices. o Assist contractors in setup procedures for items above such as PTP alignment, head end installation, configuration, and testing. • Testing, Signoff, and Launch o Ensure Testing has met requirements.  Work with design engineers to rectify any configuration or design issues and facilitate continuous design improvement. o Complete Soft launch/launch procedures and acquire necessary signoffs. o Work with field personnel and sign-off on release of contractor. • Follow and improve documented procedures as needed. • Assist in post-build inventory, documentation finalization, and hand-off to customer assurance.     Qualifications: Education: • Bachelor of Science in Engineering/Technical/Compute Science or equivalent technical experience is preferred. Experience:   • 5+ years Engineering/Planning/Operations Telecommunications experience implementing Wi-Fi, and/or FTTX, Microwave, or G.hn. Key Competencies: • Understanding of Networking: IP addressing and routing. • Understanding of Wi-Fi propagation in indoor and outdoor environments and how to test SLAs and roaming. • Understanding of a wide range of Wi-Fi devices such as computers, smartphones, TV, in a bring your own device environment. • Basic understanding of Wi-Fi authentication. • Basic understanding of design and design technologies. • Ability to access network devices, build, and understand configurations. • Firm understanding of the service ordering process including installation and delivery. • Must have skills in defining, evaluating, solving, and presenting alternatives to complex engineering problems and in applying engineering and economic principles. • Basic proficiency with various computer applications and Microsoft Office suite applications to include, but not limited to: Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Additional proficiency with Access and Visio is helpful. • Any experience with telecommunications, inventory management systems, AutoSketch, CAD, software map tools is relevant. • Familiarity with reading schematics, blueprints, or wiring diagrams is relevant and helpful. • Basic understanding of the service ordering process including installation and delivery. • Must have strong interpersonal and good administrative skills with ability to multi-task and influence change. If challenges are opportunities, then this role is for you. The above description covers the most significant duties performed but does not exclude other occasional work assignments not mentioned. in an Equal Employment Opportunity organization Job Type: Full-time remote Benefits: Salary – DOE Full-time salaried position, which may periodically include work on nights and weekends. Employee sponsored health benefits. 401K match Please submit resume and cover letter to Skills: Network Engineering, Wireless Communication, Raspberry Pi

description: Hi, Our platform is an online form builder site. The forms are visible at www.formbuilder.com/form/form_id Our architecture is as follows AWS Route53 - Cloudfront - ALB - ..... We have this form builder site "www.formbuilder.com" which points to a cloudfront distribution. We have added this subdomain "customdomain.formbuilder.com" which points to a cloudfront distribution. Our form url is "www.formbuilder.com/form/form_id" We want other people to be able to show our forms using their domain. For example our client owns the domain "coinplanet.in" we want them to be able to show our form on this url "forms.coinplanet.in/form/form_id". How can we do it? In our Route53 record 👇 https://pasteboard.co/iCCp4fIYI1WU.png In Client's Route53 record 👇 https://pasteboard.co/oncFzEFb4u0k.png But the thing is it is not workingSkills: System Administration, Windows Server, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Windows PowerShell, Amazon Web Services, VMWare, Microsoft Hyper-V Server, Veeam, VMware Administration, VMware ESX Server, ConnectWise Automate, Amazon ECS

title: Distributed System – Design and Implementation of A System for Remote File Access - Upwork
description: This project involves creating a file management service that enables various file operations over a network using UDP socket programming, without the use of high-level remote method invocation (RMI), remote procedure call (RPC), CORBA, or Java object serialization techniques. The service encompasses reading from, writing to, monitoring updates on files, and a client-side caching mechanism to optimize read operations. The service's design adheres to strict requirements for message marshalling/unmarshalling, fault tolerance, and supports two different invocation semantics: at-least-once and at-most-once. ### Service Functionalities: 1. **Read Operation**: Users can read a specific number of bytes from a file at a given offset. If the requested file or offset is invalid, an error is returned. 2. **Write Operation**: Users can write a sequence of bytes to a specified offset in a file. If the file doesn't exist or the offset is invalid, an error is returned. 3. **File Update Monitoring**: Users can register to monitor a file for updates over a specified interval. During this time, any updates are sent to the registered clients. Multiple clients can monitor a file simultaneously. 4. **Client-side Caching**: Files read by the client are cached locally to expedite future read operations. Updates are immediately sent to the server to ensure cache consistency, implementing the approximate one-copy update semantics. ### Requirements and Implementation Strategies: - The system comprises a server and multiple clients, communicating through UDP sockets. The server manages files stored locally, performing requested operations and replying to clients. The clients interface with users through a simple text-based console, sending requests to the server and displaying responses. - **Message Marshalling/Unmarshalling**: All messages, including file paths, content, and commands, are transmitted as byte arrays. This requires converting integers, strings, and other data types into a sequence of bytes before transmission and reversing this process upon receipt. - **Fault Tolerance**: The design includes measures for handling lost messages and ensuring reliable communication despite the unreliability of UDP. Techniques such as timeouts, request identifiers for detecting duplicates, and maintaining request histories are employed. - **Invocation Semantics**: The system supports both at-least-once and at-most-once invocation semantics. This involves managing timeouts and filtering duplicate messages. The semantics choice affects fault tolerance and consistency, particularly in handling non-idempotent operations. - **Client-side Caching**: Cached content metadata includes the file path and the last validation time. This cache helps in reducing network calls for read operations but requires synchronization with server updates to maintain consistency. - **Simulation of Message Loss**: The program simulates the loss of messages to test the effectiveness of the two invocation semantics. Experiments demonstrate that at-least-once semantics may lead to incorrect results for non-idempotent operations, whereas at-most-once semantics provide correct outcomes for all operations. ### Development Considerations: - The server and client programs must be capable of concurrent operation, with the server handling requests in a sequential manner due to the assumption of well-separated client requests. - The system avoids the use of Java's built-in serialization and I/O stream classes, requiring manual implementation of data transmission mechanisms. - Detailed logging of requests and responses is essential for monitoring system operation and debugging. - The project demands well-commented source code for clarity and maintainability. This summary encapsulates the project's goals, functional requirements, and technical strategies within the constraints of using low-level programming constructs for network communication and data handling. The focus is on reliability, consistency, and fault tolerance in a distributed file management context.Skills: Java

WATCH VIDEO FOR MORE DETAIL.   Video: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/a5httd7bqa38xqs6b5xyi/Data-Project.mp4?rlkey=c69lge1x13l7uz1tgbb2gmum5&dl=0 Company Background: Equity Connect (HQ: Phoenix, AZ) is a real estate investment firm that has created a niche in distressed acquisitions through proprietary data harvesting and analysis, where they purchase directly from the homeowner, and without the use of real estate agents. Problem: Equity Connect currently uses stand alone and independent software’s to extract data from many different sources. Data is warehoused independently and analyzed independently. They also use overseas assistants to manually read through PDF to harvest data that can later be used. The combination of these things creates a very inefficient, highly manual system, without the ability the re-use data because there is no centralized data warehouse.   Solution: Create robust web crawlers for data extraction. Implement OCR/LLMs to scan and extract plain text from thousands of PDFs daily. Discard or warehouse the plain text that is extracted from PDFs using specific parameters. All extracted data (web crawled) is tied to a specific piece of real estate where the property locations are displayed in one of three ways 1) address, 2) parcel number, or 3) legal description. All results must be normalized into Address format. Student is allowed to hire subject matter experts for help, in addition to labor on repetitive tasks with approval of company. Scope A & B: Build web crawler in MondoDB to Extract information via OCR • Build Web crawler to scrape “Maricopa County Recorder” https://recorder.maricopa.gov/recdocdata/ Document Codes to search and harvest: 1. Substitution of Trustee on Deed of Trust 2. Notice of Trustee Sale 3. Lis Pendens • Every night, at midnight, initiate webcrawler application • Need ability to specify “Begin Date” & “End Date” • Need ability to specify “Document Code” • Rate limits, shuffle IP’s AWS hosted • .net application / HTTP Requests • Each record will have a corresponding PDF – We need to OCR to read this PDF, and based on the parameters provided (Use LLMs?), import data into Database o Each Recording will have a different set of parameters than need to be harvested. o Each Recording will have a different data sets than need to be imported into database. Note: The objective is to associate each of the #1-4 recordings above, with a property address. And there will be three ways a property is identified within each PDF: o Property Address o Assessor Parcel Number (“APN”) o Legal Description Note: Inside the database will be a “Master List” of all parcels within Maricopa County. Steps for obtaining a property address based on what is provided below. o Property Address – No Master Database Search. Verify Address via USPS Validation o Assessor Parcel Number (“APN”) – Search Master List by APN to obtain property address, then validate property address via USPS Validation o Legal Description - Search Master List by Legal Description to obtain property address, then validate property address via USPS Validation • When validating address via USPS validation – we need to specify which addresses are Vacant inside MongoDBSkills: MongoDB, Python, Database, Data Scraping
